caseTitle: Air Marshal Retd. Muhammad Asghar Khan v. Gen. Retd. Mirza Aslam Baig, etc.
tagline: Asghar Khan Case - The general election held in the year 1990 was subjected to corruption and corrupt practices as in view of the overwhelming material produced by the parties during hearing it has been established that an “Election Cell” had been created in the Presidency, which was functioning to provide financial assistance to the favored candidates, or a group of political parties to achieve desired result by polluting election process and to deprive the people of Pakistan from being represented by their chosen representatives.
